content:
Name of Faculty: Science         Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Program:M.Sc. Clinical Embryology         Type: Theory + Practicals
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Subject: DSC-3 Assisted Reproductive Technology\r(ART) -1                       Semester: 2
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 h + 60 h
Course Description:\rThe course is designed to introduce students to the set up of the Assisted Reproductive Technology\rCenters, the basic requirements for establishing the center, the documentation and management\rsystems for smooth functioning and database maintenance at the center. The course also deals with\rthe basic techniques for handling animal cells in in vitro conditions.                               NaN
                                                              Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be able to:\r1.Understand the need and criteria for the ART-IVF center set up.\r2.Apply knowledge of animal cell handling and aseptic technique for embryo culture.\r3.Learn significance and importance of documentation and data management at the center.                               NaN

Name of Faculty: Science         Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Program:M.Sc. Clinical Biotechnology         Type: Theory + Practicals
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Subject: DSC-4 Endocrinology & Developmental\rBiology                       Semester: 2
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 h + 60 h
Course Description: This Course will make students ready with all relevant background to deal\rwith Hormones & developing Oocyte- embryo. It will provide fundamental knowledge about key\raspects of the neuroendocrine system & developmental stages of a human foetus.                               NaN
                           Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be\r●well informed about basic concepts of endocrine glands, hormones, stem cells , &\rdevelopment of foetus\r●will acquire knowledge about different disorders as well                               NaN

Name of Faculty: Science     Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Program:M.Sc. Clinical Embryology      Type: Theory + Practical
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Subject: SEC-2 Genetics and Preimplantation\rGenetic Diagnosis (PGD)                   Semester: 2
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 + 60
Course Description:\rThe course aims at catering the knowledge about basic Genetics and genetic basis of certain\rdevelopmental defects and genetic disorders.The course specifically covers the genetic correlation\rwith infertility disorders in male as well as female. The other part of the course deals with the\rimportance and technicality of Preimplantation Genetic diagnosis of embryo before implantation\rinto the uterus. It encompasses the application of PGD in screening in case of patients with\rrecurrent IVF failures or recurrent pregnancy losses. It also elaborates on principles and working of\rthe micromanipulator which plays as the heart of the IVF center.                           NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be able to:\r1.Correlate genetic causes and basis for infertility related genetic disorders.\r2.Apply the techniques to assess the embryo feasibility and normalcy before implanting into\rthe patient.\r3.Learn about operating the micromanipulator.                           NaN
